answerText: meningitis[10] Meningitis is diagnosed partly by examining this clear fluid that flows through the ventricles of the brain. Meningitis can be distinguished from GBS by looking for albumino-cytologic dissociation in this tissue.
heading: Penn Bowl |2013 | 12 | 20 | Science | Biology | College
subject: Science
question: Question: This disease can be caused by bacterial infection with H influenzae type B or a namesake species of Neisseria, and is often diagnosed using a lumbar puncture. [10] Name this disease, whose aseptic form can be caused by West Nile virus or Echovirus. This condition is the inflammation of the protective tissue surrounding the brain and spinal cord.
